Happy 15th Anniversary to the Clark County Black Caucus!

Since 2007, @CCDBC has become one of Nevada's most influential advocacy groups and has accomplished so much for BIPOC families and students across the state. I was honored to be a part of this celebration. https://t.co/eq29mRBbtC

One third of the warming from greenhouse gasses is due to human-caused emissions of methane. I joined my colleagues in supporting @EPAMichaelRegan's new proposed rule which would enact tougher standards on air pollutants, including removing 41 million tons of methane by 2035. https://t.co/XYSysEfhvn

It's never too early to get politically active. I spoke with @1001Coronado students and @SomosVotantes about the need to have young people involved in the electoral process as we continue the fight to combat climate change. https://t.co/KxkwLF3Wb6

During #PublicSchoolsWeek we thank the educators and support staff who create safe, welcoming learning environments to help students grow. Near the glitz and glamour of the Las Vegas Strip lies a burgeoning Arts District. I welcomed @englishhotellv to #OnlyInDistrict1 today with @ChefToddEnglish, @mayoroflasvegas, @OliviaDiazLV, and local restaurant and business owners in downtown. https://t.co/vcyLOp722i

Last week I led a letter with my colleagues calling on Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (@USDA_APHIS) to confiscate animals at a Virginia facility who have suffered documented abuses and suspend the operating license for the establishment. https://t.co/OXY6TEjJ8L

I spent the day with Jovan Johnson and Sisters in the Brotherhood to learn more about their training programs and discuss how the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will promote apprenticeship opportunities for women and communities of color in Nevada. https://t.co/aGs2Dbj67q

Now aided by Russian troops in Ukraine, a new course has been set that is bound to lead to an escalation in violence toward the Ukrainian people. We‚Äôve reached a tipping point. It is critical that democracies of the world push back on autocratic forces seeking to undermine them

The U.S. stands ready to support Ukraine‚Äôs right to self-determination, assist its democratically elected government, and impose unprecedented sanctions on Russia. Since the unwarranted attack in 2014, Russian-backed separatists have spurred persistent violence in Ukraine.
Beginning with the invasion of Crimea in 2014, Ukrainian sovereignty has been subject to persistent aggression from Vladimir Putin and his totalitarian regime. https://t.co/DTtpXojmmm
Happy #PresidentsDay! https://t.co/QpRreuDhHk

The dedicated workers who care for our children shouldn't have to choose between their health and their livelihoods. I'm a cosponsor of the ESP Family Leave Act which would ensure that 2.7 million education support professionals have access to unpaid leave.

Great day to be at the 13th Annual Black History Month Festival at @SpringsPreserve to celebrate the many contributions of our African American community and honor the legacy of Dr. John Crear, one of Nevada‚Äôs first black physicians. https://t.co/c9gsP6GJIZ
At Valencian Gold last night, another great local restaurant that helped feed the community during the pandemic. https://t.co/Rixha0Ihip
Enjoyed the chance to sit down with @News3LV for a #ConnectToCongress discussion about my new legislation protecting Nevada's wild horses and burros. https://t.co/cRxrgzWAhN

Currently the NIH spends $12 billion a year on animal testing. I'm cosponsoring the HEARTS Act which would prioritize non-animal testing, methods, and research which are often more effective and help spare significant numbers of animals from pain and distress.

Until we pass appropriations for FY 2022, funding remains locked into previous spending levels and blocks our ability to fully implement the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw. I sent a letter to House and Senate leadership urging swift passage of the FY 2022 appropriations bill. https://t.co/bjJ4Ox25BT

Throwing it back to my tap dancing days in Tifton, Georgia. Can you guess which one is me? #TBT https://t.co/3blbhEOrlD

Every year, millions in Pell Grants go unclaimed by Nevada students because they fail to fill out their FAFSA form.

This year, I'm teaming up with the @NVTreasurer to remind high school seniors to apply for federal student aid. More information below: https://t.co/Hm82I04WiI https://t.co/kqkptq0YwK

I‚Äôm grateful to the community and tribal leaders who have worked on this issue for years. I thank Commissioner @MichaelNaft for his leadership and @BoulderCityNev, and the Town Boards of Laughlin and Searchlight for their support of this legislation. https://t.co/68EnHbomze

Protecting our public lands has always been an important issue to me, from leading the charge to protect Basin & Range and Gold Butte to preserving Tule Springs. 

We all must be good stewards of our unique landscapes and keep them in trust for future generations to enjoy.

With the support of over two dozen tribes, conservation and business leaders, and elected officials, I believe it‚Äôs time we protect Avi Kwa Ame.

Today I introduced a bill to designate nearly 450,000 acres of this biodiverse and culturally significant land as a national monument.

‚ÄúNevada Congresswoman Dina Titus has spoken out against these measures for years. Now she's introducing a new bill that would end the use of helicopters and find more humane and inexpensive ways to address the wild-horse issue.‚Äù - @KNPRnewsüéßhttps://t.co/8Z2AQew2C0

Women are often disproportionately impacted by climate change yet underrepresented in the development of adaptation policy. I'm cosponsoring the Women and Climate Change Act which would establish an Interagency Working Group on women and climate change within @StateDept.

I'm a cosponsor of the PRIDE Act to ensure federal agencies that regulate financial services are promoting inclusivity for LGBTQI+ communities in their management, employment, and business activities.

The @BLMNational's Pancake Complex roundup is over, leaving over 2,000 horses captured and 26 horses dead.
 
We must do a better job of protecting these iconic creatures. I introduced the Wild Horse and Burro Protection Act to do just that.

Thank you Commissioner @MichaelNaft for your leadership on this issue. 

I look forward to working with you as I introduce legislation to designate Avi Kwa Ame as a national monument and protect this sacred and beautiful region. https://t.co/Et41SC3zro

üéßTune into State of Nevada on @KNPRnews üìª this morning at 9:00am to hear about my work in Congress and new legislation I've introduced to protect Nevada's wild horses and burros. #SaveAHorseHireACowboy

‚úÖ6.6M jobs created in @POTUS Biden's first year

‚úÖ467K jobs created in Jan

"Organize, agitate, educate, must be our war cry."

There's nothing sweeter than taking action to address climate change on Valentine's Day. Thank you for the card @NVconservation and @LCVoters. https://t.co/AZwYJL4W4C

Happy Valentine‚Äôs Day from Tom and me. We hope you are able to take some time today to appreciate those you love. https://t.co/1C45mIZFWh

Happy #SuperBowl Sunday! I am confident we will see the @Raiders playing in this game in the near future. Maybe even a home game at @AllegiantStadm in 2024 for #SuperBowl LVIII. Until then, I'm here for the commercials!

On this day in 1909, the @NAACP was founded on the centennial of Lincoln's birthday following deadly, anti-black violence in Springfield, IL. The nation's oldest and largest civil rights organization is a critical leader in the ongoing fight for civil rights and equal justice.

I look forward to working with Ted Pappageorge in the continued effort to empower workers.

#PrEP plays a vital role in preventing new HIV infections. Last year @US_FDA approved a potentially transformative injectable form of #PrEP, but not all insurances are required to cover it. I joined my colleagues in calling on CDC and CMS to ensure it is accessible. https://t.co/6XRar1GM0r

Nevada is home to the largest population of wild horses in the nation. Taxpayer-funded roundups and removals are not only costly and ineffective management strategy, they endanger the lives of these animals, particularly when helicopters are used.

The semiconductor chip shortage continues to hinder our economic growth, jeopardize national security, and threaten the gaming industry both online and in Nevada.

This bill includes investments I've called for to expand domestic semiconductor manufacturing immediately.

Fred Korematsu left an enduring legacy of courage and conviction for civil rights. He fought the internment of Japanese Americans during WWII all the way to the Supreme Court. Today we must honor his legacy by continuing to fight bigotry, ignorance, and intolerance. #KorematsuDay

My very first vote in Congress was for the @lily_ledbetter Act. I'm proud of my record supporting women, but we have more work to do. Today on the anniversary of its signing, we must recommit to ending wage discrimination against women.

Many seniors live on fixed incomes derived from Social Security, making it vital that COLAs reflect rising costs and other necessities. I'm a co-sponsor of the Fair COLA for Seniors Act to protect these earned benefits against rising costs for prescription drugs and other care.

The climate emergency in Southern Nevada is here and we must act on it now.

I'm proud to support the #AmericaCOMPETES Act which invests in repairing and rebuilding resilient electric grids and supports research for clean energy technology.
